title: Does Christianity as described in the Bible support dualism of the mind and body? - Quora

response.answer_text: In Christianity they each have specific roles, but the human is an integrated whole. I suppose you could think about this like an engine and a transmission. They are distinct, but part of an integrated whole. The mind and the brain are similarly distinct, but part of an integrated whole. The mind and body are distinct, but part of an integrated whole. So I think resolving the dispute between dualism and monism is more complex than one might think.

“support”? I think not. For, consider that before Christ’s work Plato had his Socrates at one point suggest that “perhaps the soul weaves the body… sort of analogous to “I grow my own hair”. [That would not be dualism, although a distinction is made.] I, myself, find that an intriguing possibility. One {the Christian] philosopher Leibniz urges, although using a different mode of expression.). A clear and influential statement of dualism is that provided by Descartes—and it is the paradigm understanding of dualism until this day.
